alert.note: Alert for Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 6:45PM MDT until August 15 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL KANE AND EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON COUNTIES... At 645 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated prior thunderstorms produced heavy rain across portions of Zion National Park, including Behunin Canyon, Spry Canyon and The Subway. Between approximately 0.5 and 1.5 inch of rain has fallen. Zion National Park reported multiple waterfalls across the western portions of the park. Additionally, the North Fork Virgin River Near Springdale recorded a rapid rise, peaking at approximately 884 CFS at 625 PM MDT. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of slot canyons, dry washes, creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park and Springdale. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
